Back to Johannes Brahms

Johannes Brahms

Sixteen Waltzes, op. 39

1865

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 17' 30"

  • 1. B major
  • 1. B major (simplified version)
  • 2. E major
  • 2. E major (simplified version)
  • 3. G-sharp minor
  • 3. G-sharp minor (simplified version)
  • 4. E minor
  • 4. E minor (simplified version)
  • 5. E major
  • 5. E major (simplified version)
  • 6. C-sharp major
  • 6. C major (simplified version)
  • 7. C-sharp minor
  • 7. C-sharp minor (simplified version)
  • 8. B-flat major
  • 8. B-flat major (simplified version)
  • 9. D minor
  • 9. D minor (simplified version)
  • 10. G major
  • 10. G major (simplified version)
  • 11. B minor
  • 11. B minor (simplified version)
  • 12. E major
  • 12. E major (simplified version)
  • 13. B major
  • 13. C major (simplified version)
  • 14. G-sharp minor
  • 14. A minor (simplified version)
  • 15. A-flat major
  • 15. A major (simplified version)
  • 16. C-sharp minor
  • 16. D minor (simplified version)

These pieces are arrangements of waltzes originally written for piano duet. For each piece, Brahms made two solo piano arrangements, one easier than the other. Brahms later made further arrangements of nos. 1, 2, 11, 8 and 14–15 for two pianos.

Recommended editions

  • Neue-Brahms Ausgabe (Henle) · III/6 · HN 6014 · Klavierstücke · ed. Katrin Eich [both versions]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 9602 · ed. Christian Köhn [non-simplified version]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 9603 · ed. Christian Köhn [simplified version]
  • Henle · HN 1286 · ed. Katrin Eich [non-simplified version]
  • Henle · HN 1287 · ed. Katrin Eich [simplified version]
  • Könemann · K 116 · Scherzo, Balladen, Rhapsodien und Tänze · ed. Enikő Gyenge [both versions]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50073 · ed. Hans Höpfel [non-simplified version]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50046 · ed. Hans Höpfel [simplified version]
